pageContext.description: Filed and bent up at A, where gilt bronze shows. Edge is corroded at B + chipped at C. The other marks round about edge (Right hand side), denote warty encrusted places. Butt has been sharp + is now chipped. Burred over + filed at D. Facets on the sides are not clearly defined, this is chiefly due to corrosion.
pageContext.patina: Yellowy, muddy green, the sides are darker or medium green.
pageContext.other: Width: edge 89mm; middle 46.5mm; butt 32mm,Thickness: nearly 11mm; 11.25mm; 12.5mm,Weight (approx.): 644.96 gms
pageContext.collection: In the possession of a working man (a slater) at Trefriw (1927),(Borrowed for dwg. by H. Higgins)
pageContext.site: wales,gwenedd,trefriw,in the cafnant stream by the fairy falls,1926
